verbs.description: belaud (third-person singular simple present belauds, present participle belauding, simple past and past participle belauded)

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To load with praise; praise greatly; extol.
examples: Not, I am bound to say, that Lindsay was belauding his own prowess. But, what was worse, he appeared a centre of enormous interest to the men around him.
